poem:
Title: "Paying for the Unseen"

Oh, the modern world and its invisible grace,
A story of bills for gas out of place.
Each room echoes with a chuckle mute,
At the comedy in a gas-less pursuit.
So here's to the power that doesn't flow,
A toast with the phantom glow. 
As we ponder and quietly marvel,
In a world lit up by an electric marvel.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling sympathetic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Don’t get too cocky – this modern world can leave you fuming and flailing | Deirdre Fidge The modern world allows us to discover new and exciting ways of being humiliated every day. I recently had an such an experience when receiving costly gas bills: the property I lived in had no gas. Quite a simple fix, you’d think, as the entire block of one-bedroom flats was powered only by electricity and a vague aura". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
